basis: User reiterates clear, actionable plans and explicitly requests a backup option, signaling strong motivation to implement and adapt the plan.
cognitive_dissonance: Low to moderate. User balances BED-related struggle with a restart-not-perfection mindset, indicating a willingness to act while managing internal tension about slips.
negative_thought_patterns: Possible all-or-nothing tendencies when overwhelmed; occasional self-criticism if progress feels imperfect.
emotional_triggers: BED urges, heat-related discomfort, perceived overwhelm, environmental cues (e.g., availability of snacks).
coaching_notes: Keep delivering simple, concrete steps and add practical backups (pre-portioned snacks, grounding exercises). Encourage honest mood/triggers logging and emphasize restart-not-perfection. Check in on progress and adjust pace to stay light and doable.
